pageContent.title: Checking In
pageContent.descriptionText:
Checking InYou - “Dr. Gomez. I hope your week is going well. I wanted to check in because the last time we spoke it was specific to a patient readmitted with clinically significant asymptomatic hyponatremia. I’m interested in hearing how things are going with the treatment of that patient.”

Dr. Gomez – “We’ve had the patient on fluid restriction for the past 36 hours. It hasn’t been easy – the patient has been complaining about thirst, and last night a family member snuck her a glass of water. She’s a textbook example of how difficult fluid restriction can be. I’m ready to consider alternative treatments.”

You – “Great. I’d be happy to discuss how Samsca might be helpful in this situation. Do you have a few minutes for us to talk now?

Dr. Gomez – “Could you actually come back this afternoon? I have a patient I’m going to see now.”

You – “Sure. I’ll see you then.”
